session.title: Simulation for Professional Services Agreement
session.jurisdiction_note: Contract governed by California law, with specific provisions for termination, indemnification, and compliance with state and federal regulations.

timeline.title: Contract Effective Date
timeline.description: Agreement takes effect upon COMMISSION board approval and notification to proceed
timeline.detailed_description: The Agreement becomes effective only after approval by the COMMISSION governing board and written notification to proceed from the Contract Manager. CONSULTANT must commence work post-notification.
risks: Work performed prior to approval is non-reimbursable
Delayed start may impact project timeline

timeline.title: Monthly Invoice Submission Deadline
timeline.description: Invoices due within 45 calendar days after work performance
timeline.detailed_description: CONSULTANT must submit itemized invoices no later than 45 calendar days after performing billable work. Invoices must include labor details, expenses, progress reports, and cumulative charges.

timeline.title: Progress Payment Due
timeline.description: Monthly payments in arrears based on satisfactory services
timeline.detailed_description: COMMISSION makes progress payments monthly in arrears upon approval of services and costs. Payments include pro rata fixed fee if applicable.
risks: Payment delay if deliverables not met

timeline.title: Compliance and Audit Window
timeline.description: Records must be maintained for 5 years post-final payment
timeline.detailed_description: CONSULTANT must retain all books, documents, and records related to the Agreement for 5 years after final payment or until audit acceptance, whichever comes first.
risks: Audit disputes can incur additional costs

timeline.title: Agreement End Date
timeline.description: Contract concludes on specified end date unless terminated or extended
timeline.detailed_description: The Agreement ends on the specified date, but early termination options exist for convenience or default, with associated costs.
risks: Default may lead to reprocurement costs

exit_comparisons.label: Termination for Convenience by COMMISSION
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: Reimbursement limited to incurred costs, no profit margin

exit_comparisons.label: Termination for Default by COMMISSION
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: All future payments forfeited, liability for COMMISSION costs

exit_comparisons.label: Termination by CONSULTANT (120-day notice)
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: Contract benefits terminated, potential reputational damage

narratives.title: Ideal Compliance Scenario
narratives.subtitle: Full adherence to contract terms
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT delivers all services on time, submits invoices within 45 days, and maintains required insurance and records. COMMISSION approves work and makes timely payments. The agreement concludes naturally with no disputes.
key_points: All milestones met per Exhibit A
financial_impact: Total cost: As per Exhibit B fee schedule

narratives.title: Default Termination Scenario
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT fails to cure breach within 10 days
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT breaches a contract term (e.g., fails to maintain insurance) and does not cure within 10 days of written notice. COMMISSION terminates for default, seeks reprocurement costs, and withholds payments. CONSULTANT faces significant financial penalties.
key_points: CONSULTANT liable for all reasonable costs

long_term.label: Year 1
long_term.description: Base contract value plus initial compliance costs

long_term.label: Year 2 (if extended)
long_term.description: Cumulative costs including potential amendments and inflation adjustments

long_term.label: Post-Contract (5-year audit window)
long_term.description: Estimated cost of record maintenance and potential audit compliance

risk_alerts.message: Insurance Compliance Risk: Failure to maintain required insurance (e.g., $1,000,000 general liability) allows COMMISSION to terminate immediately. Recommendation: Regularly renew policies and provide certificates to COMMISSION.
risk_alerts.impact: Termination for default, liability for reprocurement costs up to ₹75,000

risk_alerts.message: Invoice Submission Deadline: Invoices must be submitted within 45 days of work performance. Late submissions risk payment delays and contract disputes. Recommendation: Implement strict invoicing protocols.
risk_alerts.impact: Payment delays, potential breach if persistent

risk_alerts.message: Indemnification Clause: CONSULTANT must indemnify COMMISSION for all claims arising from negligence. This exposes CONSULTANT to significant unbudgeted liabilities. Recommendation: Secure adequate professional liability insurance.
Record Retention Requirement: Records must be kept for 5 years post-payment. Non-compliance can lead to penalties during audits. Recommendation: Establish a secure document management system.
risk_alerts.impact: Fines and reputational damage if audited

risk_alerts.message: Termination for Default: Uncured breach within 10 days notice leads to termination and liability for all COMMISSION costs. Recommendation: Monitor contract compliance rigorously and respond immediately to notices.
risk_alerts.impact: Immediate termination, financial penalties up to ₹75,000, legal costs
